text: I have a dictionary of 200,000 items (the keys are strings and the values are integers).
What is the best/most pythonic way to print the items sorted by descending value then ascending key (i.e.

code:
a={ 'keyC':1, 'keyB':2, 'keyA':1 }
b = a.items()
b.sort( key=lambda a:a[0])
b.sort( key=lambda a:a[1], reverse=True )
print b
>>>[('keyB', 2), ('keyA', 1), ('keyC', 1)]
